text: This may not be my favorite Castlevania (personally, I’d take Bloodlines and Symphony of the Night any day), but hot damn, does it come close.
author: KimonoFlareonGX

text: What a soothing song
author: Liam Voss

text: "I'm interested in this." oh wait, wrong game.
author: pootis spencer

text: I think Nintendo made developers add "super" to their titles, which is unfortunate because that ultimately cheapens the name considerably. Regardless, this is an excellent game with a superb soundtrack.
author: Dat Indigoku

text:
This is my favorite Konami game, too. It's arguable whether Symphony of the Night and Dawn of Sorrow are better, but this is my personal favorite. 

It's unfortunate there were so few linear Castlevania games after this one-- it was such a triumph that it's a shame they haven't made too many like it. There's only been, what, Rondo of Blood and (20 years later) The Adventure Rebirth?
author: drunyon214

text: Anyone want to place a bet on which track from this game SD will upload next? (Cuz ya just KNOW that he'll come back to this game at some point...) My money is on Room of Close Associates.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: No way, that theme is too short. My bet is on Waterfall. Such a great theme despite playing in only one screen.
author: drunyon214

text:
My freaking favorite tune from 4.  Was waiting on this one for quite a while.  

(Have you ever done Sinking Old Sanctuary or any of its variants?  That's probably my favorite CV tune out of the entire series.)
author: Honatuto

text: This is my favorite Castlevania. I'd love to see another game made like this with level progression and not "metroidvania" style. Sadly that probably won't happen. Bring on Bloodstained, I hope it doesn't get delayed as much as mighty no 9.
author: PRChingon

text: SupraDarky, you have uploaded many great songs, thanks for the hard work bro. Do you ever plan on doing something else like top 10s, etc? maybe some analysis on why some songs hit you the way they do? Would be awesome to hear more from you.
author: Sanjoob

text: Love this track so much, my most listened from the OST.  It's just so damn chill.  Still have the cart from near SNES launch too <3
author: xSayPleasex

text: My favorite Konami game too, I love the Metroid-style Castlevanias but I always prefered this style. Makes the music so much more memorable.
author: Alfonso ST

text: It reminds me a bit to Mike Oldfield's album Ommadawn
author: DanySk8014

text:
Hey there Supra, first time writing a message to one of your videos I believe, just wanted to thank you for all the games and OST you made me discover, you're truly a boss.
As for your information, I saw that a game named Samorost 3 was released not that long ago on Steam, which is a game done by the developers of Machinarium... And since you already put some musics here, I thought you may give it a try. :)
Thank you again for everything you've done and keep on uploading. :D
author: Ezyriel

text: +Volkerball2005 Thanks for the message and supporting the channel! I finished Samorost 1&2 and saw that 3 just released, but am surprised by its 20$ price tag. I'm guessing it must be much longer than the prequels, maybe around Machinarium's length? I'll definitely play it this year.
author: SupraDarky

text:
+SupraDarky Glad to have your answer, I feel honored !
After reading some reviews, people are saying that Samorost 3 is surpassing by far its predecessors, it seems that the Amanita Design studio have pushed their talent beyond everything they've done before. I didn't see any mention about the length of the gameplay but it should be longer than Samorost 2 with that 20$ tag yeah. Have fun with that game. :)
author: Ezyriel

text: Reminds me a lot of when I first heard the music from the SNES, at a VG store where someone was demoing Super Mario World.
author: Jay DiNItto

text: Castlevania, my eternal love <3
author: Ahmed360

text: That's one for the books.
author: Sephiko

text: The percussion adds a lot of substance in the small portion its in, really makes this song groove
author: BigMacOpossum

text: still one of my fav game soundtracks and one of the best tunes from it!, thanks SD!
author: SirSquash

text: Legendary game with a legendary soundtrack. I can go back and replay this game any time any where and never get tired of it. Sure the acid sewers level sucks but the rest of the game is a masterpiece. Proud to call it #9 on my top 10 favorite games of all time.
author: genesisSOC

text: Aw I wouldn't say it sucks, the level is pretty cool thematically.  That last bridge with the disappearing blocks is a bitch though heh, right before the boss!
author: xSayPleasex

text: Hopefully Bloodstained ends up being a good game with a great OST, like the older Castlevania games, shame that companies like Konami and Capcom killed their older franchises.
author: Cheese

text:
+SupraDarky So many good franchises didn't survive the 2D to 3D transition gracefully. it's too bad they won't sell the licenses to up-and-coming developers, instead forcing them to kickstart spiritual successors, but at least Iga has bloodstained coming soon. 
Been enjoying your channel for years, and just finished my quest to go through each video sequentially. But I noticed an absent list that I'd love to see your take on: top VGM with a focus on vocals. Things like ways to fall, suteki da ne, or the great mighty poo (not that all three of those make my personal top ten).
author: Joe Maxwell

text: Ahhh Konami, what happened to you. How could you let such amazing and classic franchises down like that. Castlevania, Silent Hill, Metal Gear, Suikoden... What a bummer. Looking back at my list of favorite games of all time, this is actually my favorite Konami game ever.
author: SupraDarky

text: Hopefully, another company will take control of those franchises and treat them with respect.
author: j

text: I hope,especially hudson's IPs
author: Roberth Anthony Martinez Rivero

text: +SupraDarky Nintendo is the only video game company I can think of who treats their games with love and care in the 2010s just as much as they did in the 1980s.
author: electricmastro

text: +electricmastro Although you make a good point quite a few Paper Mario and Metroid fans will disagree with you. Still, compared to most companies that's still a fairly positive track record.
author: Wardog 1991

text:
@Wardogblacky EX
Every company has their bumps in the road, but I think Nintendo has run into them the fewest number of times compared to others.
author: electricmastro

text: Cheers to that my friend.
author: Wardog 1991

text: +SupraDarky I have this game in my Snes as i type this comment. :D
author: Name

text: +SupraDarky Part of me wants Nintendo to buy Konami and revive classic series like these.
author: Moop Bread

text: This game his visuals and vibes lure me to check it out. The OST is rocking no doubt!
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: +SupraDarky Now days everyone cares about graphics. I say screw graphics give me content, give me something fun to play....  it would be nice to see classic konami games remade, don't forget sunset riders
author: Beetlemuse

text: SupraDarky They’ve turned into the Japanese EA.
author: KimonoFlareonGX
